data.title: Extreme Tic-Tac-Toe
data.statement:
In the Extreme version of Tic-Tac-Toe, players don't stop until they fill the entire grid. Given an [[N]] by [[N]] grid, whoever makes a line of length [[N]] wins. If both or neither player makes a line of [[N]], it's a {{TIE}}.

Output the outcome of a game of Extreme Tic-Tac-Toe.

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 20
The grid includes only {{X}}s and {{O}}s.
Winning line can be <<horizontal>>, <<vertical>> or <<diagonal>>.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read row:string(n)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[N]] Dimension of the grid.
<<Next [[N]] line:>> String of [[N]] characters, for each row of the grid.
data.outputDescription: The outcome of the game: {{X WINS}}, {{O WINS}} or {{TIE}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In the Extreme version of Tic-Tac-Toe, players don't stop until they fill the entire grid. Given an N by N grid, whoever makes a line of length N wins. If both or neither player makes a line of N, it's a TIE.

Output the outcome of a game of Extreme Tic-Tac-Toe.
Input
Line 1: N Dimension of the grid.
Next N line: String of N characters, for each row of the grid.
Output
The outcome of the game: X WINS, O WINS or TIE.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 20
The grid includes only Xs and Os.
Winning line can be horizontal, vertical or diagonal.
Example
Input
3
OOX
XXX
OXO
Output
X WINS
